channel.title: Setup Wizard on Connector 365 Online Help
channel.description: Recent content in Setup Wizard on Connector 365 Online Help

item.title: Level 1
item.description: Level 1 Figure 3: Setup wizard - level 1 Use the field next to the description “What do you want to rate? (cf. Figure 3) to select an existing rating or create a new one in the list that now opens (cf. Figure 4). new rating via “New” (see Figure 4). Figure 4: Existing ratings Create a validity period for the valuation using the “Valid from” and “Valid to” fields. The validity period also takes into account the posting periods of the existing business processes.

item.title: Level 2
item.description: Level 2 Figure 6: Setup wizard - level 2 The colored red digits correspond to the selected weighting of the respective criteria category and function as a button (cf. Figure 6). One click takes you to the to set up the desired criteria. The following figure 7 shows an example the setup of the “hard” factors. Figure 7: Criteria selection using the example of the “hard” criteria Define all relevant criteria in this mask.

item.title: Level 3
item.description: Level 3 In stage 3, you define the scoring of the hard and soft criteria by clicking on the fields marked in red. Figure 13: Setup Wizard - Level 3. (Control/Modification of the Point Allocation) First click on the red number of the hard criteria. A mask opens in which all assigned criteria appear. In this mask, distribute the 100 points to be assigned over any key. points using any key (cf.

item.title: Level 4
item.description: Level 4 Assign the desired vendors to the vendor evaluation (cf. Figure 15). To do this, click on the italic red text “Vendor assignment not completed”. Figure 15: Setup Wizard - Level 4 (Assign Vendors) An overview of the already assigned vendors opens. Here you have the possibility to assign further vendors or to remove already assigned vendors via the buttons “Add Vendor” and “Delete Vendor” (cf. Figure 16). Figure 16: List of assigned vendors

item.title: Level 5
item.description: Level 5 Confirm with “Next” in the wizard to proceed to the last setup step. In the window, set up the classification of the assessment (cf. Figure 17). Click the red italicized text “Classification not completed”. Figure 17: Setup Wizard - Level 5. (Definition of classification) Press the “New” button to create a new classification. In the following, the evaluation code “TEST VALUED” is selected as an example. The creditors will be marked with the classification codes “A”, “B”, “C” or “D” according to the score achieved.
